00001 # QuEST
00002 
00003 ## Versions
00004 
00005 QuEST is currently in prerelease and may be unstable.  
00006 
00007 Latest version: [0.11.1](https://github.com/aniabrown/QuEST/releases/tag/v0.11.1) 
00008 
00009 Please report errors or feedback to anna.brown@oerc.ox.ac.uk 
00010 
00011 ## Introduction
00012 
00013 The **Quantum Exact Simulation Toolkit** is a high performance simulator of universal quantum circuits. QuEST is written in C, hybridises OpenMP and MPI, and can run on a GPU. Needing only compilation, QuEST is easy to run both on laptops and supercomputers, where it can take advantage of multicore and networked machines to quickly simulate circuits on many qubits.
00014 
00015 > The GPU version of QuEST is currently located in another repository [here](https://github.com/aniabrown/QuEST_GPU), though the introduction in [examples/tutorial.md](/examples/tutorial.md) is still relevant.
00016 
00017 QuEST has a simple interface, independent of its run environment (on CPUs, GPUs or over networks),
00018 ```C
00019 hadamard(qubits, 0);
00020 
00021 controlledNot(qubits, 0, 1);
00022 
00023 rotateY(qubits, 0, .1);
00024 ```
00025 though is flexible
00026 ```C
00027 Vector v;
00028 v.x = 1; v.y = 0; v.z = 0;
00029 rotateAroundAxis(qubits, 0, 3.14/2, v);
00030 ```
00031 and powerful
00032 ```C
00033 ComplexMatrix2 u;
00034 u.r0c0 = (Complex) {.real=.5, .imag= .5};
00035 u.r0c1 = (Complex) {.real=.5, .imag=-.5}; 
00036 u.r1c0 = (Complex) {.real=.5, .imag=-.5};
00037 u.r1c1 = (Complex) {.real=.5, .imag= .5};
00038 unitary(qubits, 0, u);
00039 
00040 int[] controls = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
00041 multiControlledUnitary(qureg, controls, 5, 0, u);
00042 ```
00043 
00044 ## Getting started
00045 
00046 QuEST is contained entirely in the `.c` and `.h` files in the `QuEST/` folder. To use QuEST, copy these files to your computer and include `qubits.h` in your C code. We include make files for compiling QuEST, and submission scripts for using QuEST with SLURM and PBS. See [examples/tutorial.md](/examples/tutorial.md) for an introduction. Clone or download this entire repository to include all examples as well as tests and documentation. 
00047 
00048 ## API Documentation
00049 
00050 View the API [here](https://aniabrown.github.io/QuEST/qubits_8h.html), and the full documentation at https://aniabrown.github.io/QuEST/
